text: Draught @ U Slovanske Lipy, Prague. Pours dark golden with an creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, caramel, light butter, nuts, hay. Flavor is rather sweet, malty, caramel, bready, nuts, hay, light alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation, light sweet finish with a bit of alcohol. 250316

(Draught at Zly Casy, Prague, 19 July 2014) Reddish amber colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, slightly roasted nose with notes of crisp-bread, orange peel and rye bread. Malty, slightly roasted taste with toast, rye bread, orange peel and a balanced spicy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a certain sweetness. Well made and tasty. Nice one.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2014 Bottle. A hazy amber beer with a lazing beige head. Lightly fruity aroma. Nothing special.
Drafted at klub malych pivovaru in Pilsen.Pours cloudy amber with a sweet fruity aroma.Hints of honey,orange,spice,citrus,toffee,sweet malt and butter.
Reddish-brown and hazy.  Toasty, buttery aroma.  This is quite sweet, carmelly and soft.  Not a complex or interesting beer.

Draught @ Plan B, Frederiksborggade 48, 1360 Copenhagen, Denmark.Light light unclear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toffee, buttery, sugar, Fruit acidic notes. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (050908)

Draught, sampled from a small glass at Plan B. Shining amber body with a low, white head. Smell of brittle caramel. Sweet malts in flavour, partly offset by dried fruits. Dry ending. More body in this one compared with the 12 variant (Copenhagen, 15.09.2008).
Slunce ve Skle Beer Festival,1.5 litre bottle. dark shade of amber, some toffee and tinny aromas. hints of peach, some caramel, light grassy bitterness, a it on the sweet side but drinkable

Draught at plan b, Copenhagen.
Dark gold.
Malty, rich beer, caramel sweetness. Soft and round. Hops giving aroma, but not much bitterness.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2008  Draught  Very good head, dense & creamy over clear amber beer. Sweetish, citrussy smell (oranges) and some caramelmalts, rather subdued. Dry, very malty and caramelly flavour with again a citrus touch. End nearly sugary sweet, totally at odds with the start. I seem to get a tad of diacetyl too. Sticky mouthfeel, seems partly unfermented. Too sweet by half.

Big beige head leaving fine laces. Clear deep copper colored. Caramel and toffee aroma. Notes of farmyard and mould. Nice sweet cream-caramel flavor nicely balanced by some gentle bittering hops. Tasty, smooth and filling. Malty, hopbitter ending. Close to the 12, very nice.

Tap @ Plan B Copenhagen. Orange blonde, hazy. Rich malty, buttery aroma with grassy hops. Full bodied, malty grassy citric buttery flavor. Toffee, lingering on in the aftertaste. Just diacetyl or intentional. It’s anybody’s guess...
Draught at Plan B. Clear dark amber - white head. Red berries, strawberries, raspberries, malty sweetness, light sourness, caramel, minerals, wierd -> a bit bad !!!

From tap at Plan B. Pours slight cloudy orange with a creamy off-white head. Hoppy and caramelish sweet aroma. Flavour is sweet caramelish with a nice hoppy fruity base flavour. Yet also mild butterish. Lasting hoppy fruity finish with a mild bitterness yet also lasting sweet.

Draft. A hazy amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma is sweet grainy combined with light notes of butter and caramel, nicely Czech. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of caramel as well as lighter notes of butter and sltraw, which carries all the way thru to the finish.
Draught. Ckear amber, good off-white head. Aroma of caramel and toasty malt with a mild frutiness. Soft mouthfeel. Mild sweet caramel fruity malty flavour.

Tap @ Plan B, Cph.
Pours clear, dark golden with a great, creamy, lightly off-white head. Good duration, great lacing. Lightly fruity aroma, some caramel and a weak buttery note. Okay mouthfeel. Flavour has quite a lot of butter, very sweet. Some caramel. A touch vinious in the finish with some light spices.
